item.title: Florida looms large in Republican 2024 primary...
item.description:
thehill.com
Florida is emerging as the epicenter of the early fight for the GOP presidential nomination as speculation grows about the possibility of as many as four Republicans from the Sunshine State pursuing the party's nod in 2024.

item.title: Trailblazing Arab lawmaker shakes up Israeli politics...
item.description:
apnews.com
TEL AVIV, Israel (AP) — Mansour Abbas broke a longstanding taboo when he led his Arab party into Israel's governing coalition last year. The bold move appears to be paying dividends. Abbas, a once obscure politician, is the linchpin of the shaky union, securing hefty budgets and favorable policies for his constituents and even winning an audience with the king of Jordan.

item.title: Sweden puzzled by drones spotted over nuke power plants...
item.description:
apnews.com
COPENHAGEN, Denmark (AP) — Swedish authorities are puzzled by reports that drones last week were seen hovering over two nuclear power plants on the country's Baltic Sea coast. Police said Sunday that preliminary investigations have been launched, adding the probes are being handled locally by investigators but they are coordinated nationally by the Swedish police’s national operational department.

item.title: Brit named in Tex Terror...
item.description:
apnews.com
COLLEYVILLE, Texas (AP) — A rabbi who was among four people held hostage at a Texas synagogue said Sunday that their armed captor grew “increasingly belligerent and threatening” toward the end of the 10-hour standoff, which ended with an FBI SWAT team rushing into the building and the captor's death.

item.title: After Biden's first year, virus and disunity rage on...
item.description:
apnews.com
WASHINGTON (AP) — From the inaugural platform, President Joe Biden saw American sickness on two fronts — a disease of the national spirit and the one from the rampaging coronavirus — and he saw hope, because leaders always must see that.

ROBYN BECK/AFP via Getty ImagesThere was a time when Donald Trump made news with his rallies—when he said things that utterly shocked us. item.title: From pandemic to endemic: Can 2022 succeed where 2021 failed?
item.description:
economictimes.indiatimes.com
The appetite for economically damaging lockdowns is long gone. Vaccines are protecting swathes of the population, and there is even hope that omicron, with its frenetic spread and less powerful punch, may be hastening the path to the pandemics exit.

item.title: Dutch royals to temporarily halt Golden Coach, following colonial criticism...
item.description:

King Willem-Alexander has said the Dutch royal family will temporarily stop using the Golden Coach until "the Netherlands is ready," following criticism of colonial ties to the horse-drawn carriage.
